messages.text: `w`  is set to `[1.0]`  and then there is a transformation `max.(w, 0)` which is trivially simplified. I'm not sure why `w`  is not a non-trivial value

elements.text: and then there is a transformation
which is trivially simplified. I'm not sure why

messages.text: I think it could probably be assumed to be `1.0`. The `w` is the scaling factor from the homogenous self-dual embedding. Afaik, the extra variable is introduced so that primal and dual infeasibility certificates can be returned. The primal dual “solution” usually returned by a solver is `x/w`, `y/w`.  Maybe just leftover from that?

messages.text: Related to this topic, data scaling can really help the homogenous self dual embedding solvers convergence. I’d imagine that it could help with the derivative as well if the linear system solve is the dominant part?
